intro: Gaura angustifolia var. strigosa, commonly known as the silver leaf gaura, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features slender, upright stems with small, showy pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and native plant gardens. This variety is known for its delicate, airy look and its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
